results.title: Senses and perception: links to the outside world
results.creator_credit: Giancarlo Lui, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Shows differences in the process of sensory perception in higher animals and man. Emphasises that the senses are an animal’s link to its environment and are necessary for its survival.
Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Sense of taste
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Countless guidebooks to the epicurean delights of the Continent have obscured to many, the traditional delicacies of the British table and cellar. This film shows some of the delicacies which have made Britain famous; the haggis, kippers and whisky of Scotland, the York ham, Oxford marmalade and the Stilton cheeses of the towns and cities of provincial England. In London, at the “Cheshire Cheese” tavern in Fleet Street, visitors may partake of the celebrated “Pudding” - made with rump steak, kidneys and oysters and weighing some 60 pounds.

results.title: Sense of home: getting older in a new country
results.creator_credit: Brian Rapsey, St George Migrant Resource Centre and Rhapsody Pictures
results.brief_description: Isis Hanna (Egyptian), Sammy Kwong (Chinese), Stavroula Pikros (Greek) are three elderly Australians. All emigrated to Australia, but at different times in Australia’s migration history. This documentary shares their stories and explores the effect of cultural difference and assimilation. They talk openly about aging in a foreign country ‘when home is no longer home’ and what they plan for the future. All subjects of the documentary have been part of a special program in Sydney at St. George Migrant Resource Centre designed for elderly migrants. Once a week each migrant group gets together to share a meal, socialise and tell stories.

results.title: Sense of guilt
results.creator_credit: Robert English, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A psychological portrait of a man who’s life has been marred by the horrors of war, as seen by his son. The English family were aware that when George English came back to Australia after the war he was a changed man but it wasn’t until son Robert volunteered to go to Vietnam that feelings George couldn’t disguise any longer came to the fore. In telling his story of his voyage back to Australia and their detour through Java. it became clear that George had been hiding the profound sense of guilt about surviving the war when many of his colleagues didn’t.

results.title: Sense and sensibility (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Lindsay Doran, Columbia Pictures and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor follows her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast includes Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Barry Letts and BBC
results.brief_description: The story centres around two devoted sisters, Elinor, whose dignity and restraint represents “sense” and Marianne, excitable and impetuous, who represents “sensibility”. Forced by tragic circumstances to set about the delicate task of finding suitable husbands the two sisters suffer a series of disappointments and wonder if they will ever find true love and happiness. A dramatic adaptation of the novel by Jane Austen.

results.title: Sensation and Perception
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Perception is our way of using our sensory apparatus to make contact with our environment. How does our brain recognise objects? In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines how we sense and perceive our environment, to process information and transform raw sensory data into meaningful impressions. He also discusses the way personal experience can influence our perceptions.

results.title: Sensation and perception
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Do our senses show us what is real or is reality merely a perceptual construction? This is a question which has challenged philosophers and psychologists alike since early times. Modern research shows that the senses filter reality, but that they can build a valid model of reality. Humans are very dependent on the sense of sight and the program looks closely at how vision works. Finally the influence of stress and other emotions on our perception of reality is explored.

results.title: Senka (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A young Yugoslavian woman with two small children is caught between her need for friendship and social contact at work, and the difficulties of finding someone to look after her children during the day. The ideal solution to the problem, Kindergarten, is not available to her.
